name: Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)
notes: Need-blind aid meets 100% of demonstrated need for all students.

name: Stanford University
notes: Families earning under $75k pay no tuition. Strong AI research.

name: Carnegie Mellon University
notes: Top-ranked CS school globally. Pioneer in AI and robotics.

name: Harvard University
notes: Need-blind for internationals. Families under $85k pay nothing.

name: California Institute of Technology (Caltech)
notes: Small but extremely research-intensive. Generous aid.

name: Princeton University
notes: No-loan financial aid policy. Meets full need.

name: University of California, Berkeley
notes: Public university, lower tuition than private Ivies. Top CS program.

name: Georgia Institute of Technology
notes: Affordable top-tier engineering. Online MS in CS available.

name: University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign
notes: Top-5 CS program in the US. Strong research output.

name: University of Washington
notes: Located in Seattle near major tech companies. Strong AI lab.

name: University of Cambridge
notes: Gates Cambridge Scholarship available for international students.

name: University of Oxford
notes: Clarendon and Rhodes Scholarships available. World-class AI research.

name: Imperial College London
notes: UK's leading STEM-focused university. Strong industry links.

name: University College London (UCL)
notes: DeepMind collaboration. Strong AI and machine learning research.

name: University of Edinburgh
notes: Home to one of the oldest AI research groups. Informatics school is world-class.

name: University of Manchester
notes: Birthplace of the modern computer. Strong CS department.

name: ETH Zurich
notes: Very low tuition (~$1,500/year). World-leading STEM. Excellence scholarships available.

name: EPFL (Swiss Federal Institute of Technology Lausanne)
notes: Low tuition (~$1,500/year). Strong AI, robotics, and data science.

name: Technical University of Munich (TUM)
notes: No tuition for most programs. Germany's top technical university.
